intro: Peucedanum hispanicum var. atlanticum, commonly known as the Atlantic cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, white or greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, parsley-like fragrance. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal dunes and cliffs.
